summary: The Lumbee Fairness Act proposes to amend the Lumbee Act of 1956 to grant federal recognition to the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina. This includes defining the Tribe, extending federal recognition, making the Tribe and its members eligible for federal services, authorizing the Secretary of the Interior to take land into trust for the Tribe, and outlining jurisdiction over tribal lands in North Carolina. The bill also specifies procedures for verifying the tribal roll and addresses the application of federal laws to the Tribe.
